item.title: Good Material
item.description:
å†…å®¹ç®€ä»‹ Â· Â· Â· Â· Â· Â·

Every relationship has one beginning. This one has two endings.

Andy loves Jen. Jen loved Andy. And he can’t work out why she stopped.

item.title: All Fours
item.description:
å†…å®¹ç®€ä»‹ Â· Â· Â· Â· Â· Â·

Julyâ€™s second novel, which follows a married mother and artist who derails a solo cross-country road trip by checking into a motel close to home and starting an affair with a younger rental-car worker, was the yearâ€™s literary conversation piece, dubbed â€œthe talk of every group text â€” at least every group text composed of women over 40â€ and â€œthe first great perimenopause novelâ€ in just two of many articles that wrestled with its themes. Sexually frank and laced with the novelistâ€™s loopy humor, the book ends up posing that most universal question: What would you risk to change your life?

ä½œè€…ç®€ä»‹ Â· Â· Â· Â· Â· Â·

William McGuire “Bill” Bryson, OBE, FRS was born in Des Moines, Iowa, in 1951. He settled in England in 1977, and worked in journalism until he became a full time writer. He lived for many years with his English wife and four children in North Yorkshire. He and his family then moved to New Hampshire in America for a few years, but they have now returned to live in the UK.
